snippet: George Scott, the founder of Educational Housing Services, the city’s largest provider of student housing other than the colleges themselves, agreed to a $5.5 million settlement.
abstract: George Scott, founder of Educational Housing Services, New York City's largest provider of student housing other than colleges themselves, agrees to pay $5.5 million to settle civil fraud case; state investigators found that Scott and his wife Yun Suk Scott siphoned millions of dollars from the agency through a shell company for personal use.
lead_paragraph: George Scott, the founder of Educational Housing Services, the city’s largest provider of student housing other than the colleges themselves, agreed to a $5.5 million settlement.

headline.seo: George Scott, Renter to N.Y.C. Students, Settles Fraud Case
headline.main: Major Renter to Students to Pay Millions for Civil Fraud
headline.print_headline: Major Renter To Students To Pay Millions For Civil Fraud
